comments: This includes the space around the edges that is used to fasten the stock to the spoilboard
This stock is plywood that is nominally 1/2" thick, but it's actually a little undersized.
It is meant to be bolted to the jig base.  Use it with a 1/2" bit in a 3/4" OD bushing, which gives a 1/8" overhang.

job.comments: We can safely cut deeper than this, but the plywood tears out if the first cut is too deep.,

comments: This is the window for the router bushing. There's a 1/8" overhang on each side for the bushing,
so this results in a 5/8" x 1 1/4" slot.  A 1/4" washer will slide in that slot.  To cut the slot for the 1/4" bolt,
switch to a 5/8" bushing and a 1/4" bit and cut as deeply as possible.  Finish by drilling the rest of the way through
and cleaning up with saw and chisel.
and use the same depth of rail slot in the jig faceplate.
cuts.name: window

comments: This slot is just slightly more than 3/16" deep, which means I can put in a 3/8" T-slot extrusion
and use the same depth of rail slot in the jig faceplate.
cuts.name: rail slot left
